article_title: For military veterans who want to become entrepreneurs, the first steps are usually the hardest
article_text:
Military veterans often are drawn to entrepreneurship

Public, private and social resources are available for veterans seeking to become small-business owners

Here are the stories of five who are in various stages of the transition

article_metadata.news-keywords: Veterans, entrepreneurs, vetrepreneurs, Ceravolo, Farrell, Walker, Marenco, Blagg, Woodard
article_metadata.description: When Rob Ceravolo’s impressive U.S. Navy career was nearing its end in 2009, the fighter pilot with 41 missions and two Air Medals during Operation Iraqi Freedom could have sought a lucrative job with a major airline. But he decided instead to use his military leadership and team building skills to take a big leap of faith and follow his dream, launching Tropic Ocean Airways in Key West with one seaplane that had been flown by actor Matthew McConaughey in the movie Fool’s Gold.
article_metadata.title: For military veterans who want to become entrepreneurs, the first steps are usually the hardest | Miami Herald
